metadata.title: CVE-2022-2625 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL. This attack requires permission tocreate non-temporary objects in at least one schema, the ability to lure orwait for an administrator to create or update an affected extension in thatschema, and the ability to lure or wait for a victim to use the objecttargeted in CREATE OR REPLACE or CREATE IF NOT EXISTS. Given all threeprerequisites, this flaw allows an attacker to run arbitrary code as thevictim role, which may be a superuser.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.22-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
